problem_text:
Given a group G of finite order n, does there necessarily exist a bijection f from G onto a cyclic group of order n such that for each element x ∈ G, the order of x divides the order of f(x)? An affirmative answer in the case where G is solvable was given by F. Ladisch.
I. M. Isaacs
answer: Yes, it does (M. Amiri, J. Pure Applied Algebra, 228, no. 7 (2024), 107632).
